metadata.title: CVE-2018-18585 on Ubuntu 14.04 LTS (trusty) - medium
metadata.description:
chmd_read_headers in mspack/chmd.c in libmspack before 0.8alpha accepts afilename that has '\0' as its first or second character (such as the "/\0"name).

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-18585` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

clamav - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
clamav-base - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
clamav-daemon - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
clamav-freshclam - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
clamav-milter - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
clamav-testfiles - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
libclamav7 - 0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2
No subscription required

criterions.comment: libmspack package in trusty is affected and needs fixing.
clamav package in trusty was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '0.100.2+dfsg-1ubuntu0.14.04.2').
